daily_details.description: Choose well-drained, sandy loam soil with good sunlight.
daily_details.precautions: Avoid waterlogged or heavy clay soils.

daily_details.description: Check pH (should be between 5.5 and 7.5) and nutrient status.
daily_details.precautions: Apply lime if soil is too acidic.

daily_details.description: Remove weeds and stones; level the field.
Dig pits of size 3ft x 3ft x 3ft at 7.5m x 7.5m spacing.
daily_details.precautions: Keep proper spacing for good root spread.

daily_details.description: Fill pits with topsoil, compost, and neem cake.
daily_details.precautions: Avoid fresh manure to prevent root burn.

daily_details.description: Install irrigation system if needed (drip preferred).
Allow soil to settle before transplanting.
daily_details.precautions: Cover pits to prevent animal entry.

daily_details.description: Use 8–12 month old healthy seedlings from high-yielding mother palms.
Plant seedlings in prepared pits and firm the soil.
daily_details.precautions: Plant during early monsoon or irrigate after planting.

activities: Mulching around base with dry leaves.
monthly_summary.precautions: Avoid water stagnation around root zone.
Do not damage young roots while weeding.
Monitor for early signs of pests like red palm weevil.

activities: Final fertilizer dose of the year.
Install support if the plant is leaning.

phases.description: Palm grows vegetatively and develops canopy. Fruiting begins in 4–5 years.

activities: Apply 1/3rd full dose of fertilizer (NPK + Mg).
Full dose of fertilizer in split applications.
Ensure adequate boron and zinc nutrition.
Start regular harvesting if nuts mature.

phases.description: Regular flowering and nut production stage. Productivity peaks between 10–25 years.
activities: Apply 500g N, 320g P, 1200g K, 25kg FYM per palm/year.
Monitor and control pests: red palm weevil, eriophyid mite.
Install pheromone traps for pest control.

phases.description: Yield starts to decline; palms may be removed or replanted.
actions: Plan replanting with intercropping or multi-storey cropping system.
